programme.title: Sex and the City
Seks w wielkim mieście
Sex and the City
programme.desc:
Sex and the City: Created by Darren Star. With Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon. Four female New Yorkers gossip about their sex lives (or lack thereof) and find new ways to deal with being a woman in the late 1990s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0159206/","name":"Sex and the City","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGEyNDRjM2QtY2VlYy00OWRhLWI4N2UtZTM4NDc0MGM0YzBkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four female New Yorkers gossip about their sex lives (or lack thereof) and find new ways to deal with being a woman in the late 1990s.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0159206/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rmphw9"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"About Sex and the City","reviewBody":"This is decidedly one of the best written and acted comedies I've seen in a very long time. The trials and tribulations of Carrie Bradshaw and her three friends is as riveting as it is true. As a straight male viewer of this show, I think that it gave me a lot of insight into the female aspect of a relationship and the world as a whole. This show also changed the way the public views women. Carrie and company are strong, self-sufficient women who even dislike serious relationships and the prospect of marriage. This is far from the housewife days of "Leave it to Beaver" and "Father Knows Best". 

Particularly stunning about this show is the acting. Although much has been said about the relationships between the stars of the show, the characters they portray have such a sense of reality and conviction that they seem like ordinary people trying to get by. Why this show was not awarded more is beyond me. 

For anyone who wonders about human relationships and interaction, this funny yet sometimes surreal show is the perfect addition to your viewing pleasure."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117052,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1998-06-06","keywords":"friendship between women,friendship,love life,casual sex,new york city","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000326/","name":"Kim Cattrall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004862/","name":"Kristin Davis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020963/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050436/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0823015/","name":"Darren Star"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sex and the City: The Sixth Season - Part 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi394723609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI0MjIzN2YtMTlhYS00ZjM0LThkZTAtZTU4ZDdlODEzZjViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI0MjIzN2YtMTlhYS00ZjM0LThkZTAtZTU4ZDdlODEzZjViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"}}</script><metacontent="

Four female New Yorkers gossip about their sex lives (or lack thereof) and find new ways to deal with being a woman in the late 1990s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0159206/","name":"Sex and the City","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGEyNDRjM2QtY2VlYy00OWRhLWI4N2UtZTM4NDc0MGM0YzBkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four female New Yorkers gossip about their sex lives (or lack thereof) and find new ways to deal with being a woman in the late 1990s.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0159206/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rmphw9"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"About Sex and the City","reviewBody":"This is decidedly one of the best written and acted comedies I've seen in a very long time. The trials and tribulations of Carrie Bradshaw and her three friends is as riveting as it is true. As a straight male viewer of this show, I think that it gave me a lot of insight into the female aspect of a relationship and the world as a whole. This show also changed the way the public views women. Carrie and company are strong, self-sufficient women who even dislike serious relationships and the prospect of marriage. This is far from the housewife days of "Leave it to Beaver" and "Father Knows Best". 

Particularly stunning about this show is the acting. Although much has been said about the relationships between the stars of the show, the characters they portray have such a sense of reality and conviction that they seem like ordinary people trying to get by. Why this show was not awarded more is beyond me. 

For anyone who wonders about human relationships and interaction, this funny yet sometimes surreal show is the perfect addition to your viewing pleasure."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117052,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1998-06-06","keywords":"friendship between women,friendship,love life,casual sex,new york city","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000326/","name":"Kim Cattrall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004862/","name":"Kristin Davis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020963/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050436/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0823015/","name":"Darren Star"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sex and the City: The Sixth Season - Part 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi394723609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI0MjIzN2YtMTlhYS00ZjM0LThkZTAtZTU4ZDdlODEzZjViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI0MjIzN2YtMTlhYS00ZjM0LThkZTAtZTU4ZDdlODEzZjViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: You Kill Me
Mokra robota
You Kill Me
programme.desc:
You Kill Me: Directed by John Dahl. With Ben Kingsley, Téa Leoni, Luke Wilson, Dennis Farina. While drying out on the West Coast, an alcoholic hitman befriends a tart-tongued woman who might just come in handy when it's time for him to return to Buffalo and settle some old scores." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796375/","name":"You Kill Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAyMjg3NDE4MDleQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDg2NzE4NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While drying out on the West Coast, an alcoholic hitman befriends a tart-tongued woman who might just come in handy when it's time for him to return to Buffalo and settle some old scores.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796375/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WriterDave"},"dateCreated":"2007-07-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark Comedy Showcases Leoni's Talents","reviewBody":""You Kill Me" is as dark a comedy as you can get. It may also be the first artistically successful romantic comedy noir. Directed by John Dahl (best known for his indie-noirs "Red Rock West" and "The Last Seduction" and the underrated killer trucker flick "Joyride"), the film depicts a hit man (Ben Kingsley-deep in character) forced into Alcoholics Anonymous by his "family" because his drinking has been affecting his ability to kill people. Shipped off to San Franscisco to start his 12 Steps, he picks up a part-time gig at a funeral home and meets a sassy single woman with "boundary issues" (Tea Leoni-hilarious) after her step-dad dies and proceeds to start an unconventional romance with her while struggling to stay on the wagon and learn how to kill again.

The film starts off very low key, and Dahl keeps such a consistently dark tone it's hard to adjust to the cadence. As good as Kingsley is here, the show really belongs to Leoni. When she finally arrives on the scene, the film reaches a level of hilarity you weren't expecting. Her facial expressions, comic timing, and interplay with Kingsley as she learns the truth about his past are pure gold. Leoni has had her fair share of commercial successes ("Bad Boys," "Deep Impact," "The Family Man", and "Jurassic Park III") but it's in this type of offbeat low-budget comedy where she really shines. She was dynamite in "Flirting with Disaster" and was the best foil for Woody Allen since Diane Keaton in the otherwise forgettable "Hollywood Ending." Here all her comic charms are on display, and she proves that at the age of 40, she is aging not only gracefully and naturally, but with all her sexiness and innate talents in tact.

While the film goes through the predictable motions in its final act, it's the gooey goodness of the middle portion (especially one laugh-out-loud montage of Leoni helping Kingsley train for his return to "work") that will leave a smile on your face, with Leoni's luminosity as a comedic actress scorched into your mind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-07-13","keywords":"untrustworthiness,watching tv,friend,contemplating suicide,crying","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"You Kill Me","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi249757977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2OTkwNGItYzIxMy00YzMwLTlkYzEtYTMwYTc3MGY3YTNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2OTkwNGItYzIxMy00YzMwLTlkYzEtYTMwYTc3MGY3YTNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from IFC"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001426/","name":"Ben Kingsley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005561/","name":"Luke Wilson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001093/","name":"John Dahl"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058685/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143069/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208303/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321655/","name":"Christopher Markus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321656/","name":"Stephen McFeely"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

She was dynamite in "Flirting with Disaster" and was the best foil for Woody Allen since Diane Keaton in the otherwise forgettable "Hollywood Ending." Here all her comic charms are on display, and she proves that at the age of 40, she is aging not only gracefully and naturally, but with all her sexiness and innate talents in tact.

While the film goes through the predictable motions in its final act, it's the gooey goodness of the middle portion (especially one laugh-out-loud montage of Leoni helping Kingsley train for his return to "work") that will leave a smile on your face, with Leoni's luminosity as a comedic actress scorched into your mind.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-07-13","keywords":"untrustworthiness,watching tv,friend,contemplating suicide,crying","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"You Kill Me","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi249757977","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2OTkwNGItYzIxMy00YzMwLTlkYzEtYTMwYTc3MGY3YTNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjc2OTkwNGItYzIxMy00YzMwLTlkYzEtYTMwYTc3MGY3YTNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from IFC","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001426/","name":"Ben Kingsley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005561/","name":"Luke Wilson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001093/","name":"John Dahl"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058685/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143069/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208303/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321655/","name":"Christopher Markus","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1321656/","name":"Stephen McFeely"],"duration":"PT1H33M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
Gwiazdorskie życie
Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc:
Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping: Directed by Akiva Schaffer, Jorma Taccone. With Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone, Akiva Schaffer, Sarah Silverman. When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3960412/","name":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMxMzk2ODI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgzNzQ5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3960412/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tjgoalie13"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Little Formulaic, But Admittedly Funny.","reviewBody":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping never looked all that appealing to me, but I must say it was surprisingly better than I expected. Seeing the trailers I thought the film was another in a wave of ultra dumb comedies, but up front, it's really not. Popstar is a little formulaic, but is admittedly funny, and finds a way to even be witty. Even more impressive, although not all that surprising is that some of the songs in this movie are actually pretty catchy, albeit mock-ups.

For those who love This is Spinal Tap and other films of that nature, this film is a little derivative. That being said, it's not as if this is just a rehash of other better films, that entire genre does require modernizations every few years. Because this film is spoofing not only the musicians of today, but everybody in the entertainment world. That being said this film does list as another Judd Apatow film and does have some formulaic moments that appear in all of his films.

The most notable "Appatowism" in this film is the overdone comedy trope of today, where the film lingers on jokes far longer than they should, under the illusion that lingering over a joke makes it funnier. It's kinda like when a goofy kid makes a great joke everybody laughs, and then the kid gets confident and keeps pushing the joke until everybody around is just wishing he'd shut up and go away. That being said, the film doesn't live off the annoying lingering joke, and succeeds at being genuinely funny, all the time. It's not the funniest movie this year, and it may not even be hilarious, but the film is consistently littered with raunchy funny jokes, that often deliver.

The film was marketed poorly, in my opinion, because it came across as an ultra dumb comedy, and in reality isn't half as dumb as it comes across as. The film occasionally wanders into the dumb comedy area, but often finds it's way back into the land of witty comedies, making it somewhat of a mixed bag. For instance, the songs are catchy, they are witty reflections of our pop stars, but they are also a little too on the nose, making them come across as a little dumb. That being said, underneath the thin exterior of a dumb comedy is a really witty reflection of our current music industry, and the pressures, idiocracy, immaturity, selfishness, and chaos commonly associated with it.

Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping is filled with cameos from famous musicians and comedy actors, some of which even lend their singing talents to the musical pieces. At times it feels like the entire music industry is in this film, as they play along on a mockumentary making fun of them. However, the film is never really mean spirited, or all that damning it just grooves along, spoofing everybody from the musicians to the fans. For those who like the lonely island, you'll love this movie, and for those who are seeking a funny comedy, regardless of rating this is also a movie you'll love, but there should be a note, this movie really isn't for kids or the weak spined.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":58976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Musical"],"datePublished":"2016-06-03","keywords":"pop star,scene during end credits,repetition in title,concert,mockumentary","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2277946393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg","description":"When his new album fails to sell records, pop/rap superstar conner4real goes into a major tailspin and watches his celebrity high life begin to collapse. He'll try anything to bounce back, anything except reuniting with his old rap group The Style Boyz."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0346224/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

Interstellar
programme.desc: Interstellar: Directed by Christopher Nolan. With Ellen Burstyn, Matthew McConaughey, Mackenzie Foy, John Lithgow. A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0816692/","name":"Interstellar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjdkOTU3MDktN2IxOS00OGEyLWFmMjktY2FiMmZkNWIyODZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0816692/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Patterson13"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Best movie I have seen in my life","reviewBody":"This movie was the best written, acted, visual effected, etc. movie. This movie was the best movie I have ever seen. I am a huge Christopher Nolan fan and this movie was his finest. Matthew McConaughey turned in his best performance of his lifetime. Anne Hathaway was an amazing supporting actress and compared to her performance in Les Miserables, I have no idea how she didn't get an Oscar for this. The visual effects were more than just Oscar worthy. They were pioneering. I have never seen anything like it. One thing I would recommend is having a little previous knowledge about space. Not like Einstein stuff though. I would recommend you see this movie as fast as you can if you are a Nolan fan or not. I give this movie a rating of 97 out of 100.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1655773,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2014-11-07","keywords":"astronaut,saving the world,gravity,relativity,wormhole","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #4","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1586278169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5OTQzMTg4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgyMjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5OTQzMTg4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgyMjM0NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of explorers make use of a newly discovered wormhole to surpass the limitations on human space travel and conquer the vast distances involved in an interstellar voyage.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1567113/","name":"Jessica Chastain"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634240/","name":"Christopher Nolan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634300/","name":"Jonathan Nolan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634240/","name":"Christopher Nolan"}],"duration":"PT2H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Przegląd tygodnia: Wieczór z Johnem Oliverem 8
programme.desc: John Oliver, jedna z najbarwniejszych postaci amerykańskiej telewizji, zaprasza na ósmy sezon show, w którym prezentuje swój punkt widzenia i komentuje wydarzenia minionego tygodnia. Porusza polityczne kwestie, które angażują uwagę wszystkich mieszkańców USA, stosuje cięte riposty i z angielskim dystansem rozbawia widzów.

Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Nacho Libre: Directed by Jared Hess. With Jack Black, Ana de la Reguera, Héctor Jiménez, Darius Rose. Berated all his life by those around him, a monk follows his dream and dons a mask to moonlight as a Luchador (Mexican wrestler)." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0457510/","name":"Nacho Libre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2ZkNDgxMjMtZmRiYS00MzFkLTk5ZjgtZDJkZWMzYmUxYjg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Berated all his life by those around him, a monk follows his dream and dons a mask to moonlight as a Luchador (Mexican wrestler).","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0457510/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dyslexiasoftware"},"dateCreated":"2006-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie is racist...my a**","reviewBody":"Honestly people, get over it. Stop being so damn sensitive, suddenly people think everything is racist. People are so busy tripping over themselves trying to be politically correct all the time, it's ridiculous. Nacho Libre is not being racist. It's telling the story of a guy who lived in an orphanage and became a wrestler to save it. Take it for what is it...a movie. Yes, Jack Black's accent is annoying...but guess what...it's a comedy, it's supposed to be one of the things that makes people laugh. It's not supposed to be realistic so stop thinking that it has to be.\n\nGo watch the movie. It's funny and Jack Black is priceless."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85439,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Sport"],"datePublished":"2006-06-16","keywords":"lucha libre,slapstick comedy,character name as title,nickname as title,memory","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nacho Libre","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4205642009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxOWU1N2MtMWNhNy00MGFmLTg5NTQtMzJjYWE1ZjQ1MDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxOWU1N2MtMWNhNy00MGFmLTg5NTQtMzJjYWE1ZjQ1MDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478886/","name":"Ana de la Reguera"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0422948/","name":"Héctor Jiménez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381478/","name":"Jared Hess"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117811/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381478/","name":"Jared Hess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1415801/","name":"Jerusha Hess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925234/","name":"Mike White"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
Arcyoszust
The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc:
The Wizard of Lies: Directed by Barry Levinson. With Robert De Niro, Diana Henriques, Nathan Darrow, Alessandro Nivola. The fall of Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme robbed $65 billion from unsuspecting victims; the largest fraud in U.S. history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1933667/","name":"The Wizard of Lies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIxOTMxNzc1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyOTUxMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The fall of Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme robbed $65 billion from unsuspecting victims; the largest fraud in U.S. history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1933667/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trublu215"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"De Niro's performance is reason enough to watch.","reviewBody":"The Wizard of Lies chronicles the infamous Wall Street meltdown that was Madoff's Billion Dollar Ponzi scheme in Barry Levinson's woefully flawed but still engaging film. Starring Robert De Niro and Michelle Pffeifer, The Wizard of Lies features a strong cast of seasoned actors that give their best on screen. De Niro particularly is very strong here and gives his best performance in close to a decade. However, the film suffers from a broken and jumbled script that leaves for a somewhat confusing watch.

The film begins with an interview between Madoff and the subsequent author of his unofficial biography. He begins telling the story at the end of the meltdown on the eve of his arrest and starts from there. From here on out, we're told the story in chunks and pieces, from one perspective to another and totally abandons all formality regarding coherent storytelling. Instead, Levinson creates a deeply personal character study that paints Madoff as a sociopath and a white collar criminal mastermind who would rather blame the victim than himself. While it is engrossing to see De Niro as Madoff, it is barely enough to sustain its bloated runtime.

The film is engrossing to watch. There's no denying it but as the minutes ticked by, it all started to feel redundant. It was more so just dragging the entire Madoff family through hell for the remaining hour of the film and it becomes exhausting after awhile. In a way it was very much a Greek tragedy of epic proportions that just didn't seem to end and by the time it decided it wanted to, you were already checked out 10 minutes prior. Despite this, the ending is satisfying for those wanting to see karma at its best or a tragedy at its worst, whatever way you want to look at it.

Overall, The Wizard of Lies is a missed opportunity more so than not. While it is great to see De Niro and Pfeiffer in top forms, it would have been nice to get a more coherent script from a story that literally writes itself. While anyone expecting a film in the vein of The Big Short will be let down by this, The Wizard of Lies benefits from being a deep character study that shines a (small) light of one of the most tragic mysteries of the 2008 financial crisis.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24376,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-05-20","keywords":"financial fraud,financier,ponzi scheme,fraudster,fraud","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tonight 8/7c","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi42121497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MDQxNTU0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODkxODczMjI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MDQxNTU0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODkxODczMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Bernie Madoff and his Ponzi scheme."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001469/","name":"Barry Levinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063961/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506094/","name":"Sam Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2331718/","name":"John Burnham Schwartz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1345603/","name":"Samuel Baum"}],"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Elizabethtown
Elizabethtown
programme.desc:
Elizabethtown: Directed by Cameron Crowe. With Orlando Bloom, Kirsten Dunst, Susan Sarandon, Alec Baldwin. During a hometown memorial for his Kentucky-born father, a young man begins an unexpected romance with a too-good-to-be-true stewardess." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0368709/","name":"Elizabethtown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmJkOTU0ZjEtYmRkNi00ODcwLTgwMDUtNjVjMTFjZGU2OWNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"During a hometown memorial for his Kentucky-born father, a young man begins an unexpected romance with a too-good-to-be-true stewardess.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0368709/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"taylorhammons"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"A criminally underrated movie","reviewBody":"I don't know why this movie seems to have fallen by the wayside, but I haven't met anyone outside of my family who's actually seen it.

This movie is insanely underrated. It's a near perfect blend of subtle comedy and heartbreaking tragedy. It's deep and meaningful without being pretentious. It's beautifully shot without being overly artsy. It's smartly written, expertly acted, and perfectly timed. It's relatable but fresh.

Everything about this movie makes me continually want to come back to it. The soundtrack, the dialogue, the story, it's all absolutely perfect. I just wish more people knew about it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2005-12-28","keywords":"manic pixie dream girl,publicity,bad publicity,quote,cubicle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Elizabethtown","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3332636953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNhOTY2ODUtZjExOS00NzBhLThkZDMtNTdmOTg1MDVjMzViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNhOTY2ODUtZjExOS00NzBhLThkZDMtNTdmOTg1MDVjMzViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089217/","name":"Orlando Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000379/","name":"Kirsten Dunst"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000215/","name":"Susan Sarandon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001081/","name":"Cameron Crowe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001081/","name":"Cameron Crowe"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
Kill Bill 2
Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc:
Kill Bill: Vol. 2: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Vivica A. Fox, Ambrosia Kelley, Michael Parks, James Parks. The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0378194/","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmFiYmJmN2QtNWQwMi00MzliLThiOWMtZjQxNGRhZTQ1MjgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0378194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlutonicLove"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It transcends its genre and becomes Tarantino's most thoughtful and sophisticated work","reviewBody":"In my brief, initial review of 'Kill Bill Vol. 1.' I made the regrettable mistake of dismissing it as exceedingly pleasing yet unsubstantial stylistic masturbation, lacking the profundity and characterizations of Tarantino's previous works. Rarely have I been happier to be proven wrong.

What once seemed like somewhat incoherent cinematic recklessness has, after viewing the second part of Mr. Tarantino's saga, revealed itself to be wild, imaginative and brilliant filmmaking. As a whole, 'Kill Bill' is utterly unified (not despite but because of the radical shift in tone), possesses a strong, dramatic ark, and, above all, stands as quite possibly the most passionate, loving tribute to cinema I have ever seen. While part one pays homage to Brian De Palma, Dario Argento and the Shaw Brothers, part two cites, among many others, Jean-Luc Godard, Sergio Leone, and Robert Siodmark.

But that's far from all.

In his critical essay 'The Cinema of the Cool', Kevin Murphy suggests that Tarantino must move on and grow up to fully realize his potential as a filmmaker. In my opinion, with this piece, he has done so. Those merely seeking the blood-splattered, broken-bone action of Vol. 1 will be severely disappointed by Vol. 2, which is infinitely more thoughtful, pondering the nature of violence, both in cause and effect. While the action in the first installment was great, comic book fun, here it becomes severely unpleasant, cringe inducing, and never without consequence. If anything, it reminded me of the great Akira Kurosawa's work. Remarkable."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":722043,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-12-08","keywords":"bride,vengeance,revenge,female assassin,martial arts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi405667865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #1, post"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001016/","name":"David Carradine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086625/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Homemade Christmas
Święta na zamówienie
Homemade Christmas
programme.desc:
Homemade Christmas: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Michelle Argyris, Travis Nelson, Marcello Di Fruscia, Brianna Barnes. Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Ri","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13189624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good chemistry","reviewBody":"The premise boils down to consultant-comes-in-to-save-the-business but there's a different flavor to it. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. programme.desc: Olivia jest nauczycielką baletu. Na jej zajęcia chodzi bardzo utalentowana Lily, którą wychowuje samotnie ojciec, Michael. Gdy uczennica razem z tatą stają się gwiazdami viralowego filmiku tanecznego, mężczyzna zyskuje sławę, a także sympatię mistrzyni tańca.

Homemade Christmas
programme.desc:
Homemade Christmas: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Michelle Argyris, Travis Nelson, Marcello Di Fruscia, Brianna Barnes. Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Ri","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13189624/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123","dateCreated":"2020-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good chemistry","reviewBody":"The premise boils down to consultant-comes-in-to-save-the-business but there's a different flavor to it. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. She has some insecurities that come out over time, but a really tough façade.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-22","keywords":"personal assistant,toy store owner,interior designer,mistaken identity,blog","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Homemade Christmas - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi225755417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4679011/","name":"Michelle Argyris","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3303404/","name":"Travis Nelson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7077067/","name":"Marcello Di Fruscia"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1454995/","name":"Adrian Langley"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0822895/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3269314/","name":"John Dion"],"duration":"PT1H25M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stardust
Gwiezdny pył
Stardust
programme.desc: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. All in all it is a truly magical experience from beginning to end, and I now Im raving about it to EVERYONE!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2007-10-24","keywords":"witch,magic,transformation,shooting star,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stardust","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4018471193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1214435/","name":"Charlie Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325567/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301274/","name":"Neil Gaiman"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307987/","name":"Bad Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Njg1MDcwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzAxNjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. Characters are amazing. Style and film making is exceptional. Still it's a cinematic experience. And a fresh one at that.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
Assassin's Creed
programme.desc:
Assassin's Creed: Directed by Justin Kurzel. With Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons, Brendan Gleeson. Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2094766/","name":"Assassin's Creed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE1OTczNTc1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyMDI3MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2094766/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rinette"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Enjoyable","reviewBody":"I have not played the Assassin's Creed games. However, this movie did not make me feel as though I needed to have played them in order to understand or enjoy the film.

The cinematography was great, and there were some magnificent aerial views of 15th century Spain along with modern day. Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard both gave excellent performances, managing to deliver the occasional corny, melodramatic dialogue with poise, and the supporting cast were equally great in their roles. Despite the occasional cheese, this film had some excellent dialogue that were thoughtful and poignant - unexpected in a fantasy action movie! Speaking of action - this was the best part of the movie. Gorgeous choreography, and I loved all the various weaponry and free running.

This is by no means an award winning film, but overall it was incredibly enjoyable, and I don't think it quite deserves the negativity critics and fans of the games are giving it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":193925,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-12-28","keywords":"based on video game,assassin,secret society,spain,spanish inquisition","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1056093721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, he discovers he is a descendant of the secret Assassins society."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182839/","name":"Marion Cotillard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0997291/","name":"Justin Kurzel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109033/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2078681/","name":"Michael Lesslie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177836/","name":"Adam Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171651/","name":"Bill Collage"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Domestics

programme.title: Red Eye
Red Eye
programme.desc: Red Eye: Directed by Wes Craven. With Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy, Brian Cox, Laura Johnson. A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in a political assassination." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0421239/","name":"Red Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAxNjc1ODczOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE3MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in a political assassination.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0421239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alancroydon"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well directed","reviewBody":"I had fun watching Red Eye. It's not a masterpiece, but it's well directed and structured. Cillian Murphy and Rachel McAdams are perfect in the role. Yes, it's the same old story with a different setting but Wes Craven gave it a good pace. At least not another Scream with the usual college killer. It's nice when you can see a clean, coherent thriller even when originality doesn't stand out as its main character. Particularly from a film-maker like Craven that has brought so many innovative ideas to the thriller and horror genre in the past and that now just lends himself to bringing home what could have been a good TV movie had it not been released theatrically. Good job!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116914,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-09-07","keywords":"psychotronic film,flight,hotel manager,hotel,airport","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Red Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi931332377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNTVhYTYtOWFkYS00NzBlLWI2MmItMjExMTk2MWI1NGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNTVhYTYtOWFkYS00NzBlLWI2MmItMjExMTk2MWI1NGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1046097/","name":"Rachel McAdams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614165/","name":"Cillian Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004051/","name":"Brian Cox"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000127/","name":"Wes Craven"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013899/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0255296/","name":"Carl Ellsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1929257/","name":"Dan Foos"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chocolat
Czekolada
Chocolat
programme.desc:
Chocolat: Directed by Lasse Hallström. With Alfred Molina, Carrie-Anne Moss, Aurelien Parent Koenig, Antonio Gil. A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0241303/","name":"Chocolat","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjMxZWQtMzQ3OS00YWNhLThkNDItYTk4NDdhZDE4ZTEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODU5MDg5OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0241303/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FigNewton"},"dateCreated":"2001-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mmmm, Mmmm, Good!","reviewBody":"I had heard all the rave reviews, saw the number of Oscar nominations this flick received but still wasn't convinced it was a movie I'd like. I want to kick myself now for waiting this long to see it! Yes, I forsook the big screen for the video but I wasn't disappointed a bit.

Chocolat is a wonderful movie. It deals with real issues that people face. The characters are believable because they have flaws. They've got inward struggles which makes this film even better. It's a story of the human condition and how even deep prejudices can be overcome by the simple act of kindness and the willingness to strive for individuality.

I have to admit the only reason I wanted to watch this movie at first was because of Johnny Depp. I have to say I loved his performance as Roux. I wished the writers would've done more with his character but what we did get to feast on was incredible. Juliette Binoche was also incredible as Vianne and the chemistry between all the actors was great.

I would recommend Chocolat. If you haven't seen it, what are you waiting for? It's great to see there are still film makers out there that have a sense of humanity. Chocolat is all of that and more.

 Chocolat was indeed Mmmm, Mmmm, good!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":185912,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-10-24","keywords":"chocolate,france,village,food,magical realism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chocolat","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2733547033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRjNGI4MmYtY2U1ZS00N2UzLTk5MzgtMjIxYjlhMDI2NWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRjNGI4MmYtY2U1ZS00N2UzLTk5MzgtMjIxYjlhMDI2NWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001132/","name":"Judi Dench"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000547/","name":"Alfred Molina"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002120/","name":"Lasse Hallström"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031919/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104130/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364862/","name":"Joanne Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414608/","name":"Robert Nelson Jacobs"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Homemade Christmas
Święta na zamówienie
Homemade Christmas
programme.desc:
Homemade Christmas: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Michelle Argyris, Travis Nelson, Marcello Di Fruscia, Brianna Barnes. Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Ri","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13189624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good chemistry","reviewBody":"The premise boils down to consultant-comes-in-to-save-the-business but there's a different flavor to it. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. She has some insecurities that come out over time, but a really tough façade.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-22","keywords":"personal assistant,toy store owner,interior designer,mistaken identity,blog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Homemade Christmas - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi225755417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4679011/","name":"Michelle Argyris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3303404/","name":"Travis Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7077067/","name":"Marcello Di Fruscia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1454995/","name":"Adrian Langley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0822895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3269314/","name":"John Dion"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: You Can't Fight Christmas
You Can't Fight Christmas
programme.desc: You Can't Fight Christmas: Directed by Kenny Young. With Brely Evans, Andra Fuller, Persia White, Porscha Coleman. An unlikely encounter between Christmas designer and enthusiast Leslie Major, and a businessman trying to end the Christmas tradition at The Chesterton makes Leslie use all her Christmas charms on him to love Christmas. - and her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7281472/","name":"You Can't Fight Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNTY1MDUzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ0MTEzNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unlikely encounter between Christmas designer and enthusiast Leslie Major, and a businessman trying to end the Christmas tradition at The Chesterton makes Leslie use all her Christmas charms on him to love Christmas. - and her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7281472/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sotheguy"},"dateCreated":"2017-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good sunday afternoon watch","reviewBody":"This is a "sister" movie to Miss Me This Christmas ...and in my humble opinion, better. So I would advise watching that one first, then give it at least a day, then check this one. It's light hearted and they've tried to stay away from the usual stereotypes of black movies. Remember it's still a light lovable tv movie. programme.title: La noche mágica
Loving Christmas
programme.desc:
La noche mágica: Directed by Gastón Portal. With Natalia Oreiro, Diego Peretti, Esteban Bigliardi, Pablo Rago. A peaceful Christmas Eve is interrupted when a thief breaks into a house. What he isn't counting on is the family's little daughter, who mistakes him for Santa Claus and asks him to fulfill his Christmas wish list." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10742934/","name":"La noche mágica","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWVjYTU0OTMtMmIxOC00M2E5LWJkZTUtNGEyNGQ3YmYzNmI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA5NzYzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A peaceful Christmas Eve is interrupted when a thief breaks into a house. What he isn't counting on is the family's little daughter, who mistakes him for Santa Claus and asks him to fulfill his Christmas wish list.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10742934/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ops-52535"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"read mattkocians review...","reviewBody":"Cause it tells it very very good. And just let me add how much i admire the superb caracter actors in this quirky christmas movie.

Anybody whos written a gift list and sent it to santa, will know the importance of those wishes . And its indeed a santa that fulfills the little girls hopes and wishes, through love, violence, witt and magic, that only a christmas night break in burglar can do.

The film has a wonderful flow of visuals and auditorial heartbeat like rythm of sniper shots, and when the ''home alone'' feel has arrived you become like the child yourself, guessing and speculating what will happen next.

Its an unusual x-mas treat for you ,if youll let it. It handles a lot of topics and issues connected to the ''family'' consept, and i guaratee that you will have a good laugh and loads of giggles. The caracter acts, especially by nicolas done by diego peretti is award worthy.

Just mention that this is not an ''all family'' entertainment, there are violence that you wont show a 6yr old, but for all us grumpy old ones its a gold nugget to start the navidad in a felizious way.. a recommend pero...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Comedy","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-03-11","keywords":"three word title,thief,extramarital affair,unfaithful wife,cheating wife","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1811202841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFiNWQ0YWMtMDE4OS00YTRkLTk2MjktZmE5MjdjODFlN2Q3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFiNWQ0YWMtMDE4OS00YTRkLTk2MjktZmE5MjdjODFlN2Q3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"A peaceful Christmas Eve is interrupted when a thief breaks into a house. What he isn't counting on is the family's little daughter, who mistakes him for Santa Claus and asks him to fulfill his Christmas wish list."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649638/","name":"Natalia Oreiro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0673391/","name":"Diego Peretti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2013399/","name":"Esteban Bigliardi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691922/","name":"Gastón Portal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073330/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0614079/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064529/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691922/","name":"Gastón Portal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7231875/","name":"Javier Castro Albano"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Santa Squad
The Santa Squad
programme.desc: The Santa Squad: Directed by John Bradshaw. With Aaron Ashmore, Rebecca Dalton, Michael Therriault, Hattie Kragten. Allie, an out of work art teacher, has to accept a job with the Santa Squad to help wealthy widower Gordon and his two precious daughters rediscover the magic of Christmas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12787842/","name":"The Santa Squad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg1ODZmODQtY2U2ZS00YzAwLWE5MWYtMGVjMzM2MWY5NTI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Allie, an out of work art teacher, has to accept a job with the Santa Squad to help wealthy widower Gordon and his two precious daughters rediscover the magic of Christmas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt12787842/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sd-lister"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Painful","reviewBody":"It's a Lifetime movie, so my score is relative (we aren't using The Godfather scale here). The first 3/4 of the movie was pretty decent, the writing wasn't horrible, all actors were actually quite good. It's a cheesy Christmas video with zero budget, but the show was making the most of what they had. That is until the turn. All these movies follow the same general formula; two people, one of who is usually in a bad relationship, find each other, but before the soulmates can be together, some contrived plot device causes one to mistakenly reject the other. In the end, the truth is revealed, and true love wins the day. Usually, it's a conniving ex that causes all the trouble, but here, it's quite possibly the dumbest reason in all of Christmas romance TV history. I won't "spoil" it, but either the original writer, who was fairly competent to this point, went completely off the rails, or the script was hacked and butchered by a person who has never set foot in a kitchen, let alone baked a cookie. And who then decided that the main characters suffered temporary brain damage and completely lost their short term memory. I was half expecting the lead to pull some Polaroids out of her pocket so she could remember what happened two minutes prior.... Anyway, had it not been for that horrendous bit of script, this show might have ranked as one of the better low budget Lifetime efforts. As it is, I'm going with a very painful, 6 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":698,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Drama","Family","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-01","keywords":"holiday romance,art teacher,widower single women relationship,personal assistant,father daughter relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Santa Squad - Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi265666841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNjZmM1MmItMzIzNi00NmMxLTg5ZDQtMzZhNjg5MTBjYTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNjZmM1MmItMzIzNi00NmMxLTg5ZDQtMzZhNjg5MTBjYTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0039148/","name":"Aaron Ashmore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4653974/","name":"Rebecca Dalton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0857576/","name":"Michael Therriault"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103498/","name":"John Bradshaw"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263216/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0884131/","name":"Mark Valenti"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Hugo
programme.desc: Hugo: Directed by Martin Scorsese. With Ben Kingsley, Sacha Baron Cohen, Asa Butterfield, Chloë Grace Moretz. In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0970179/","name":"Hugo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNzk5MzgyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTE4NDU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0970179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Balzer13"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Visually Stunning. The best 3D to date","reviewBody":"Saw it today in a sneak preview today at the Director's Guild in LA. James Cameron who was there professed it's a masterpiece and the best 3D to date. And he's right on both fronts. The film is exquisitely crafted. The cinematography and set design is likely going to take home a couple gold guys. It's a film lover's dream movie. As with many of Scorsese's films, it's an inspired film history lesson along side of being a dreamlike children's fable. A really unique combination that will work for the film enthusiasts and discerning family's with kids. Maybe a bit long for broad audiences with very little kids, but the images are so enchanting, it should win over most everybody. Sasha Baron Cohen is a brilliant and hilarious standout as the twitchy constable. It should be very well received just on the 3D alone."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":315454,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2011-11-23","keywords":"cinema,automaton,clock,mechanical man,memory","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2781978137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMzYwMzkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDM4OTU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMzYwMzkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDM4OTU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in 1930s Paris, an orphan who lives in the walls of a train station is wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton. programme.title: The Holiday

Last Holiday
programme.desc:
The Holiday: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law, Jack Black. Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0457939/","name":"The Holiday","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1MDk4MzA2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQ3NDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0457939/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Redriter"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice~ very nice","reviewBody":"This was a really good, light hearted movie, with GREAT characterization. There are points where the movie is a little slow, but not slow enough to loose your interest.

All of the characters are wonderfully developed especially Jude Laws-the under-story of Jude's character adds an extra dimension to his character and really makes you love him all the more.

Kate Winslet's character is another that was well worked out. She helps out this little old man . . . and the character development between her and this older gentleman is wonderful . . . it adds so much to her character, makes her more human, more real, someone very likable and someone you want to end up with a good ending.

Jack Black's character was sweet, not corny . . . and you end up liking him very much. He was not a goober like he usually is in his movies.

Over all, it was a wonderfully character driven movie, that was enjoyable and had you leaving the theater feeling good. I recommend it highly!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":272438,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-12-13","keywords":"kiss,film composer,english countryside,cottage,book editor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Holiday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3321037081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="
